edu.jsu.mcis

Class XMLParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xml.sax.helpers.DefaultHandler
      • edu.jsu.mcis.XMLParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ContentHandler, DTDHandler, EntityResolver, ErrorHandler

    public class XMLParser
extends DefaultHandler
    XMLParser is an implementation of Argument Parser dedicated for XML. It implements methods used by Argument Parser and it reads all the tags in an XML file and automatically adds the arguments with their attributes to the dedicated Arguments list.

    This is done by scanning the tags within the XML file. If the format of the file is incorrect an error will be thrown and the file will not be parsed.

      • saveXMLFile

        public static void saveXMLFile(ArgumentParser argPars,
               String filename)
        Takes the information of the arguments and optional arguments - title, description, number of values, and the data type - and writes it to an XML file. Automatically generates the XML tags appropriate for each piece of data.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file to write the XML code to
        argPars - the argument parser that is used to write to the XML file

      • startElement

        public void startElement(String s,
                String s1,
                String elementName,
                Attributes attributes)
                  throws SAXException
        Starts the XML Parsing method called by the program automatically by checking each tag and starts a process using it.
        Specified by:
        startElement in interface ContentHandler
        Overrides:
        startElement in class DefaultHandler
        Parameters:
        s - the Namespace URI, or the empty string if the element has no Namespace URI
        s1 - the local name (without prefix), or the empty string if Namespace
        elementName - the name of the element in the XML file
        attributes - the attributes attached to the element. If there are no attributes, it shall be an empty Attributes object.
        Throws:
        SAXException - any SAX exception, possibly wrapping another exception

      • characters

        public void characters(char[] ac,
              int i,
              int j)
                throws SAXException
        Reads each character inside the XML file, and checks if it is a tag, attribute, etc. And saves it in a temporary variable.
